results.title: Backbeat (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Iain Softley, Finola Dwyer, Stephen Woolley, Channel Four Films, PolyGram and Scala
results.brief_description: When people remember the Beatles, they think of John, Paul, George and Ringo. However in the early days, the Fab Four were five, when Stuart Sutcliffe played alongside the legendary musicians. Sutcliffe (Stephen Dorff) had only a passing interest in music and a passion for painting. For his best friend, John Lennon (Ian Hart), Rock’n’Roll was the only art. “Backbeat” tells the true and tragic story of their friendship, the music, the woman who came between them and the wild times they shared when their innocence was lost. The legend was born.

results.title: Footloose
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Craig Zadan, Lewis Rachmil and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Ren MacCormack (Kevin Bacon) moves to Bomont, a small Midwestern town with his mother (Frances Lee McCain). The town is autocratically run by the local minister, Reverend Shaw Moore (John Lithgow). A fatal car accident has caused the reverend to prohibit music, because of the corruptive influence it has over teenagers. His daughter Ariel (Lori Singer) is opposed to her father’s views and is drawn to Ren because of his life in another place where music isn’t banned, and for the possibility that he could take her away from Bomont. Ren pushes the boundaries of the Bomont community when he tries to convince the council to allow them to have a dance. Features a great soundtrack with songs from Kenny Loggins and Bonnie Tyler.

results.title: Ashes and diamonds = Popiol i diament
results.brief_description: Set on the first day of peace at the end of World War II, this film is a bitter portrait of the ‘lost generation’ of young men who served in the underground resistance (Armii Krajowej) and who cannot reconcile themselves to the post-war communist reality. Maciek (Zbigniew Cybuslki), a young Resistance fighter, is ordered to kill Szczuka (Waclaw Zastrzezynski), a Communist district leader, on the last day of World War II. Though killing has been easy for him in the past, Szczuka was a fellow soldier, and Maciek must decide whether to follow orders. Wajda’s genius is immediately evident from the film’s opening ambush sequence, where Maciek and his compatriot mistake as their target one of two men returning from a labour camp and defines the moral and metaphysical dilemma confronting the Poles as they embrace the struggle to shape their nation’s future. A film of great power, ‘Ashes and diamonds’ is the last of the separate and self-contained stories that make up his war trilogy, preceded in 1954 by ‘A Generation’ and in 1957 by ‘Kanal’. Adapted for the screen by Jerzy Andrzejewski form his novel. In Polish with English sub-titles. Wide Screen Format (letterboxed).

results.title: Spies = Spione
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Erich Pommer and Fritz Lang Film
results.brief_description: Agent No 326 (Willy Fritsch) a.k.a Det. Donald Tremaine is ordered to stop a spy-ring, but he falls in love with one of the spies, Sonja (Gerda Maurus). No 326 tries to find the head of that organisation. He doesn’t know that this is banker Haghi (Rudolf Klein-Rogge), with whom Sonja bets, that No 326 will identify him, because she has fallen in love, too. So Haghi tries everything to confuse the secret service and to neutralize No 326. The granddaddy of all espionage movies. All the elements are here: government secrets, phony disguises, masterful strategies, sabotage, revenge, secret codes, hidden microphones, beautiful female spies, exciting chases and murder! Behind everything is a deranged but brilliant master spy in control of the entire spies network. Director Fritz Lang dishes up a delightful combination of suspiscion, terror and paranoia - a chilling reflection of the nightmarish atmosphere of pre-Hitler Germany. Silent film with English intertitles. Adapted by Thea von Harbou (a long time Lang collaborator and author of “M” and “Mabuse”) from her novel. (Edgar G. Ulmer worked as an uncredited set designer)

results.title: La Strada
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Carlo Ponti, Dino De Laurentiis and Ponti-De Laurentis
results.brief_description: In this film Fellini uses the metaphor of a journey to explore what was to become one of his favourite themes - the search for meaning and purpose in life. Gelsomina (Giuletta Masina), a simple-minded peasant girl is sold to the circus strongman, Zampano (Anthony Quinn). As she accompanies him on tour through the countryside, she bercomes the victim of his constant abuse until their meeting with a circus performer (Richard Baseheart) dramatically changes their lives. This was the film that established Fellini as one of the leading lights of European Cinema.

results.title: Dune
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Raffaella De Laurentiis and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Based on Frank Herbert’s cult science fiction novel, “Dune” follows the fortune of Paul Atreides (Kyle Machlachan), whose family is persecuted by the Emperor (Jose Ferrer) and the evil Baron Harkonnen (Kenneth McMillan). Paul and his mother (Francesca Annis) seek refuge in the deserts of the planet Arakis. They join the Fremen who live under the desert sands. Soon the prophecy of a messiah becomes true as Paul leads the Fremen in battle against the forces controlling and manipulating their planet and the precious spice Melange. David Lynch manages to create a sense of the complex dynastical world which Frank Herbert had created in his popular novel, whilst retaining Lynch’s love for the bizarre and disturbing. A large international cast provides substance to this film, including Linda Hunt, Sian Phillips, Dean Stockwell, Jurgen Prochnow, Patrick Stewart, Sting and Freddie Jones.

results.title: Two women = La Ciociara
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica, Carlo Ponti, Cocinor, Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Marceau and Societe Generale de Cinematographie
results.brief_description: The story centers on a widow (Sophia Loren) who runs a tiny grocery store in Rome. When the store is bombed, she decides to return to her native village with her 13 year old daughter (Eleonora Brown). Back in her village, a timid schoolteacher (Jean-Paul Belmondo) falls in love with her. Her young daughter also secretly falls in love with him and becomes alienated from her mother because of it. While he is on a war mision, he is killed and the mother and daughter become friends once more and agree to carry on. They seek refuge in a church as they make they way back to Rome and encounter an event that will change their lives forever. Version dubbed in English. Adapted from a novel by Alberto Moravia.

results.title: The Great snowball war
results.creator_credit: Andre Melancon, Nicole Robert, Rock Demers and Les Productions La Fete
results.brief_description: When children need to settle an argument it seems they devise inventive ways of resolving the issue. Take the two groups of children in this film, they resort to a snowball war! They are not restricted by their environment in the use of weapons either, as they grab wooden spoons, garbage lids and anything else at hand. It’s a fiercely contested battle as one group of kids takes cover in an enormous snowcastle while the opposition tries to break in. Who will win the war? Original screenplay by Danele Pantenaude and Roger Cantin.

results.title: The Dove
results.creator_credit: Charles Jarrott, Gregory Peck and St George Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Dove” by Robin Lee Graham and Derek Gill this film depicts the true story of Graham’s five year solo voyage around the world. The photography is breathtaking, as we follow Graham (Joseph Bottoms) as he sails to Fiji, Australia, Mozambique, South Africa and Los Angeles, covering a distance of 30,000 miles. Graham has no human contact during his trip, just the companionship of his cats. However, when he stops at Fiji he falls in love with Patti Ratteree (Deborah Raffin), and his departure from her is more painful due to his isolation. An inspirational film about courage and ambition that can be enjoyed by the whole family.
